meanings.sent1: I always extol my sister for her hard work in school.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will extol the students who show great improvement.
meanings.sent3: At the family dinner, we extolled the delicious homemade pie.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece was extolled as a work of genius.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to extol the bravery of the firefighters.

meanings.sent1: She would extol her favorite singer to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: The critics extolled the new movie for its originality.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to extol their pet goldfish at show-and-tell.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to extol the beauty of the blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The mayor will extol the volunteers for their dedication to the community.

meanings.sent1: The ancient tales extol the bravery of the legendary hero.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, they will extol the virtues of peace and unity.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic fans extolled their favorite team with cheers and banners.
meanings.sent4: The evening sky seemed to extol the beauty of the twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting seemed to extol the magic of nature's colors.
